New Records: Muhammad Rizwan scored his first half century of the tournament when it mattered most
Daryl Mitchell hit an unbeaten 53 off 35 balls
Key Match Events: Rizwan and Babar came into the World Cup as Pakistan's top trumps, the most successful opening partnership in T20I cricket with eight century partnerships
Muhammad Rizwan wins player of the match
Babar Azam holes out to long on!
Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan will find out their opponents in the final tomorrow night, 6:00pm AEST, when England takes on India
Babar Azam is overjoyed with the team's performance
New Zealand have been in 14 ICC tournament (World Cup, T20 World Cup or Champions Trophy) semifinals. They've won just four of them.
Post-Match Reflections: Kane Williamson is speaking, 'It is very disappointing not to make Pakistan work a little bit more for that. They were outstanding, we were outplayed today.'
Muhammad Rizwan says, 'Luckily the fifty was in the semi final, I'm lucky.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The vast majority of the 36,443 were supporting Pakistan
Pakistan will now face the winner of Thursday's semifinal between England or India at the MCG
It is Pakistan's first World Cup final since 2009, when they beat Sri Lanka in the final at Lord's.
Others: Pakistan's bowlers were sharp and purposeful in the field, New Zealand were simply sloppy
Iftakar Ahmed comes in, he's at the non-strikers end.
Rizwan gets a single to midwicket to open the scoring this over - New Zealand have no answer at the moment.
A single to Rizwan - this pair have run superbly.
A couple of runs off the misfield at mid wicket and that's a magnificent half century! It's come off 38 balls. What a performance from the skipper.
